statements: SELECT * FROM CustomerData WHERE customer_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000'
SELECT name, email FROM CustomerData WHERE email = 'example@gmail.com'
SELECT customer_id, name, phone_number FROM CustomerData WHERE name LIKE 'John%'
SELECT * FROM CustomerData WHERE purchase_history->'$.product' = 'Shoes'
SELECT customer_id, email, browsing_history FROM CustomerData WHERE browsing_history->'$.category' = 'Electronics'
SELECT customer_id, name, email FROM CustomerData WHERE phone_number = '+1234567890';
SELECT * FROM CustomerData WHERE name LIKE 'John%' ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT customer_id, email, purchase_history FROM CustomerData ORDER BY name ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT name, email, browsing_history FROM CustomerData WHERE email = 'john.doe@example.com' OR email = 'jane.smith@example.com';
SELECT DISTINCT name, email FROM CustomerData WHERE purchase_history->>'total_sales' > '1000';
SELECT customer_id, customer_name FROM customers;
SELECT customer_email, customer_age FROM customers WHERE customer_age > 30;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email, customer_age FROM customers ORDER BY customer_age DESC;
SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE transaction_amount > 1000;
SELECT customer_id, transaction_date, transaction_amount FROM transactions ORDER BY transaction_amount DESC;
SELECT customer_name, customer_age FROM customers WHERE customer_age > 30 ORDER BY customer_name DESC;

SELECT customer_name, customer_email, COUNT(transaction_id) AS total_transactions FROM customers LEFT JOIN transactions ON customers.customer_id = transactions.customer_id GROUP BY customer_id, customer_name, customer_email HAVING COUNT(transaction_id) > 1 ORDER BY total_transactions DESC;

SELECT * FROM customers INNER JOIN transactions ON customers.customer_id = transactions.customer_id WHERE transaction_amount > 1000 AND transaction_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31' ORDER BY transaction_date ASC, transaction_amount DESC;

SELECT customer_name, SUM(transaction_amount) AS total_spent FROM customers LEFT JOIN transactions ON customers.customer_id = transactions.customer_id GROUP BY customer_name HAVING SUM(transaction_amount) > 5000 ORDER BY total_spent DESC;
SELECT customer_gender, AVG(customer_age) AS average_age FROM customers GROUP BY customer_gender HAVING AVG(customer_age) > 35 ORDER BY average_age DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_id, age, gender FROM customers ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT * FROM purchases WHERE purchase_amount > 100;
SELECT customer_id, product_id, action_taken FROM browsing_history ORDER BY browse_timestamp DESC;
SELECT name, email, age FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Male';
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT customer_id, name, purchase_amount FROM customers JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id WHERE purchase_amount > 100 ORDER BY purchase_amount ASC;
SELECT DISTINCT name, product_id FROM customers JOIN browsing_history ON customers.customer_id = browsing_history.customer_id WHERE action_taken = 'clicked' AND gender = 'Female';

SELECT c.name, p.product_id, b.browse_timestamp FROM customers c JOIN purchases p ON c.customer_id = p.customer_id JOIN browsing_history b ON c.customer_id = b.customer_id WHERE c.age BETWEEN 25 AND 35 ORDER BY b.browse_timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers;
SELECT product_name, price FROM products WHERE price > 50;
SELECT * FROM purchases ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT customer_name, product_name, browse_date FROM customers c JOIN browsing_history b ON c.customer_id = b.customer_id JOIN products p ON b.product_id = p.product_id;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_name, price FROM products WHERE price > 100;
SELECT customer_name, purchase_date FROM customers INNER JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id;
SELECT product_name, price, customer_name FROM products INNER JOIN purchases ON products.product_id = purchases.product_id INNER JOIN customers ON purchases.customer_id = customers.customer_id;
SELECT customer_name, browsing_id FROM customers LEFT JOIN browsing_history ON customers.customer_id = browsing_history.customer_id WHERE browsing_id IS NULL;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_id, name, category, price FROM products ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT * FROM purchases WHERE customer_id = 2 AND purchase_amount > 100;
SELECT session_id, timestamp, page_url FROM browsing_history WHERE customer_id = 3 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_id, category, price FROM products ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(purchase_id) AS total_purchases FROM purchases GROUP BY customer_id;
SELECT rh.customer_id, r.name AS product_name, r.category AS product_category FROM recommendations rh JOIN products r ON rh.product_id = r.product_id;
